summary: The "simplification of formalities" within the context of the 2011 tariff policy aims to enhance the efficiency of customs procedures across the EU. By reducing repetitive documentation and easing the handover of goods, this initiative seeks to address unanticipated delays at seaports and borders. The tabling of proposals for streamlined processes echoes the EU's commitment to liberalising trade, ensuring that validly documented shipments are processed swiftly. This includes the use of advanced electronic options (AEO) to mitigate risks associated with hypersensitivity to xenobiotic substances. By facilitating a more trustworthy and measurable framework, the policy aims to prevent disqualifications and promote smoother intra-EU trade corridors.
